page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: { { THE OUTWELL AREA Outwell is a village that lies in the Fens between 2 counties ,Norfolk and Cambridge. The 2 nearest towns are Wisbech and Downham Market. The main roads that run through the village are the A1122 and the A1101. Outwell got it's name because of the 2 wells one up the river Welle at Upwell and the other one down stream at Outwell. The river is now called the WellCreek and it runs all the way through the village. It is used all year round for swimming ,boating ,fishing and skating.Once there was a canal that ran from Outwell to Wisbech but that was filled in about 15 years ago. Most of the land the village is used for farming. Many soft fruits and vegetables like strawberries and potatoes are grown in the area.
